thread.title: Maldives: Vice President arrested while tourism continues as normal
thread.title_full: Maldives: Vice President arrested while tourism continues as normal

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Maldives: Vice President arrested while tourism continues as normal
text:
Click here for information and nomination Maldives: Vice President arrested while tourism continues as normal 
Maldivian authorities Saturday arrested the nationâ€™s Vice President Ahmed Adeeb in connection with a plot to assassinate President Abdulla Yameen, who escaped death after his boat was hit by a bomb in September, Home Minister Umar Naseer said. The president was unhurt. 
Adheeb, who was in Singapore after inaugurating the Maldives Investment Forum in China, dismissed allegations that he was the mastermind behind the explosion. He did return and Vice President Ahmed Adeeb was in detention and being charged with high treason. 
Mr. Adeeb, who has denied any links to the explosion, had only been Vice President for three months. 
He came to office when the previous Vice President was sacked by Mr. Yameen, also on charges of treason. 
A large police and military was spotted on the capital island of Male, while tourism activities in the country continued as normal. Oct 24, 2015
